events.originalText: A freight train derailed in East Palestine, Ohio, releasing hazardous materials into the surrounding area.
events.subtitle: 2023 Ohio train derailment
events.headline: Freight train derails in East Palestine, Ohio, releasing hazardous materials

events.originalText: Russia's first school shooting took place when a student opened fire at School No. 263 in Moscow, resulting in the deaths of a teacher and a police officer.
events.subtitle: School shooting
events.headline: First school shooting in Russia at School No. 263 in Moscow

events.originalText: An edition of L'Homme qui marche I, a bronze sculpture by Swiss sculptor Alberto Giacometti, was sold for £65 million, setting the record for the most expensive sculpture sold at auction.
events.subtitle: L'Homme qui marche I
events.headline: L'Homme qui marche I sculpture sold for record £65 million

events.originalText: Despite a large international movement advocating the commutation of her sentence to life imprisonment, Karla Faye Tucker became the first woman to be executed in the United States since 1984.
events.subtitle: Commutation (law)
events.headline: Karla Faye Tucker executed despite international movement for commutation

events.originalText: Steve Jobs purchased Pixar from Lucasfilm and launched it as an independent computer-animation studio.
events.subtitle: Steve Jobs
events.headline: Steve Jobs purchases Pixar from Lucasfilm

events.originalText: The deadliest blizzard in history began in Iran and continued for a week leaving more than 4,000 people dead.
events.subtitle: 1972 Iran blizzard
events.headline: Deadliest blizzard in history hits Iran, leaving over 4,000 dead

events.originalText: American rock and roll musicians Buddy Holly, Ritchie Valens, and J. P. "The Big Bopper" Richardson died in a plane crash (wreckage pictured) shortly after takeoff from Mason City Municipal Airport in Iowa.
events.subtitle: Rock and roll
events.headline: Buddy Holly, Ritchie Valens, and J.P. Richardson die in plane crash

events.originalText: Hundreds of native creoles known as Forros were massacred on São Tomé Island by the colonial administration and Portuguese landowners.
events.subtitle: Creole peoples
events.headline: Forros massacred on São Tomé Island by colonial administration

events.originalText: Second World War: Free French and British forces (aircraft pictured) began the Battle of Keren to capture the strategic town of Keren in Italian East Africa.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Free French and British forces begin Battle of Keren in Italian East Africa

events.originalText: Adolf Hitler announced that the conquest of Lebensraum in Eastern Europe, and its "ruthless Germanisation", were the geopolitical objectives of Reich foreign policy.
events.subtitle: Adolf Hitler
events.headline: Adolf Hitler announces geopolitical objectives of Reich foreign policy

events.originalText: The Fifteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution was ratified, granting voting rights to citizens regardless of "race, color, or previous condition of servitude".
events.subtitle: Fifteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution
events.headline: Fifteenth Amendment ratified, granting voting rights regardless of race

events.originalText: The Argentine Confederation was defeated in the Platine War by an alliance consisting of Brazil, Uruguay and the Argentine provinces of Entre Ríos and Corrientes.
events.subtitle: Argentine Confederation
events.headline: Argentine Confederation defeated in Platine War

events.originalText: Argentine War of Independence: José de San Martín and the Mounted Grenadiers Regiment defeated Spanish royalist forces in the Battle of San Lorenzo.
events.subtitle: Argentine War of Independence
events.headline: José de San Martín defeats Spanish royalist forces in Battle of San Lorenzo

events.originalText: Mudéjar revolt: King James I of Aragon entered the formerly Muslim-held city of Murcia (depicted), following its surrender three days earlier.
events.subtitle: Mudéjar revolt of 1264–1266
events.headline: King James I of Aragon enters Murcia after Mudéjar revolt surrender
